1.verse: The Song of songs, which is Solomon’s.

2.verse: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth;

3.verse: Your oils have a pleasing fragrance.

6.verse: Don’t stare at me because I am dark,

7.verse: Tell me, you whom my soul loves,

8.verse: If you don’t know, most beautiful among women,

9.verse: I have compared you, my love,

10.verse: Your cheeks are beautiful with earrings,

11.verse: We will make you earrings of gold,

12.verse: While the king sat at his table,

13.verse: My beloved is to me a sachet of myrrh,

14.verse: My beloved is to me a cluster of henna blossoms

15.verse: Behold, you are beautiful, my love.

16.verse: Behold, you are beautiful, my beloved, yes, pleasant;

17.verse: The beams of our house are cedars.

1.verse: I am a rose of Sharon,

3.verse: As the apple tree among the trees of the wood,

4.verse: He brought me to the banquet hall.

6.verse: His left hand is under my head.

7.verse: I adjure you, daughters of Jerusalem,

9.verse: My beloved is like a roe or a young deer.

10.verse: My beloved spoke, and said to me,

11.verse: For behold, the winter is past.

12.verse: The flowers appear on the earth.

13.verse: The fig tree ripens her green figs.

14.verse: My dove in the clefts of the rock,

16.verse: My beloved is mine, and I am his.

17.verse: Until the day is cool, and the shadows flee away,

2.verse: I will get up now, and go about the city;

3.verse: The watchmen who go about the city found me;

4.verse: I had scarcely passed from them,

5.verse: I adjure you, daughters of Jerusalem,

6.verse: Who is this who comes up from the wilderness like pillars of smoke,

8.verse: They all handle the sword, and are expert in war.

9.verse: King Solomon made himself a carriage

10.verse: He made its pillars of silver,

11.verse: Go out, you daughters of Zion, and see king Solomon,

1.verse: Behold, you are beautiful, my love.

2.verse: Your teeth are like a newly shorn flock,

3.verse: Your lips are like scarlet thread.

4.verse: Your neck is like David’s tower built for an armory,

5.verse: Your two breasts are like two fawns

6.verse: Until the day is cool, and the shadows flee away,

7.verse: You are all beautiful, my love.

8.verse: Come with me from Lebanon, my bride,

9.verse: You have ravished my heart, my sister, my bride.

10.verse: How beautiful is your love, my sister, my bride!

11.verse: Your lips, my bride, drip like the honeycomb.

12.verse: My sister, my bride, is a locked up garden;

13.verse: Your shoots are an orchard of pomegranates, with precious fruits,

16.verse: Awake, north wind, and come, you south!

1.verse: I have come into my garden, my sister, my bride.

2.verse: I was asleep, but my heart was awake.

3.verse: I have taken off my robe. Indeed, must I put it on?

4.verse: My beloved thrust his hand in through the latch opening.

5.verse: I rose up to open for my beloved.

7.verse: The watchmen who go about the city found me.

8.verse: I adjure you, daughters of Jerusalem,

9.verse: How is your beloved better than another beloved,

10.verse: My beloved is white and ruddy.

11.verse: His head is like the purest gold.

12.verse: His eyes are like doves beside the water brooks,

13.verse: His cheeks are like a bed of spices with towers of perfumes.

14.verse: His hands are like rings of gold set with beryl.

15.verse: His legs are like pillars of marble set on sockets of fine gold.

1.verse: Where has your beloved gone, you fairest among women?

2.verse: My beloved has gone down to his garden,

3.verse: I am my beloved’s, and my beloved is mine.

4.verse: You are beautiful, my love, as Tirzah,

5.verse: Turn away your eyes from me,

6.verse: Your teeth are like a flock of ewes,

7.verse: Your temples are like a piece of a pomegranate behind your veil.

8.verse: There are sixty queens, eighty concubines,

9.verse: My dove, my perfect one, is unique.

10.verse: Who is she who looks out as the morning,

11.verse: I went down into the nut tree grove,

1.verse: How beautiful are your feet in sandals, prince’s daughter!

2.verse: Your body is like a round goblet,

3.verse: Your two breasts are like two fawns,

4.verse: Your neck is like an ivory tower.

5.verse: Your head on you is like Carmel.

6.verse: How beautiful and how pleasant you are,

7.verse: This, your stature, is like a palm tree,

8.verse: I said, “I will climb up into the palm tree.

9.verse: Your mouth is like the best wine,

11.verse: Come, my beloved! Let’s go out into the field.

12.verse: Let’s go early up to the vineyards.

1.verse: Oh that you were like my brother,

2.verse: I would lead you, bringing you into the house of my mother,

3.verse: His left hand would be under my head.

4.verse: I adjure you, daughters of Jerusalem,

5.verse: Who is this who comes up from the wilderness,

6.verse: Set me as a seal on your heart,

10.verse: I am a wall, and my breasts like towers,

11.verse: Solomon had a vineyard at Baal Hamon.

12.verse: My own vineyard is before me.

13.verse: You who dwell in the gardens, with friends in attendance,
